joelib2.gui.render2D
Class RenderHelper

java.lang.Object
  joelib2.gui.render2D.RenderHelper

public class RenderHelper
extends Object

A set of static utility classes for geometric calculations and operations. This class is extensively used, for example, to render and edit molecule.

Author:
  • Christoph Steinbeck (c.steinbeck@uni-koeln.de)
  • Egon Willighagen (egonw@sci.kun.nl)
  • Jörg Kurt Wegner.
CVS Version:
Revision: 1.10Date: 2005/02/17 16:48:32source code (CVS head)

center

public static void center(RenderingAtoms atomCon,
                          Dimension areaDim)
Centers the molecule in the given area

Parameters:
atomCon - molecule to be centered
areaDim - dimension in which the molecule is to be centered

distanceCalculator

public static int[] distanceCalculator(int[] coords,
                                       double dist)
Gets the coordinates of two points (that represent a bond) and calculates for each the coordinates of two new points that have the given distance vertical to the bond.

Parameters:
coords - The coordinates of the two given points of the bond like this [point1x, point1y, point2x, point2y]
dist - The vertical distance between the given points and those to be calculated
Returns:
The coordinates of the calculated four points

get2DCenter

public static javax.vecmath.Point2d get2DCenter(List atoms)
Calculates the center of the given atoms and returns it as a Point2d

Parameters:
atoms - The vector of the given atoms
Returns:
The center of the given atoms as Point2d

get2DCentreOfMass

public static javax.vecmath.Point2d get2DCentreOfMass(RenderingAtoms ac)
Calculates the center of mass for the Atoms in the AtomContainer for the 2D coordinates.

Parameters:
ac - AtomContainer for which the center of mass is calculated

getBestAlignmentForLabel

public static int getBestAlignmentForLabel(RenderingAtoms container,
                                           Atom atom)
Determines the best alignment for the label of an atom in 2D space. It returns 1 if left aligned, and -1 if right aligned.

getBondCoordinates

public static int[] getBondCoordinates(Bond bond)
Writes the coordinates of the atoms participating the given bond into an array.

Parameters:
bond - The given bond
Returns:
The array with the coordinates

getClosestAtom

public static Atom getClosestAtom(int xPosition,
                                  int yPosition,
                                  RenderingAtoms atomCon)
Returns the atom of the given molecule that is closest to the given coordinates.

Parameters:
xPosition - The x coordinate
yPosition - The y coordinate
molecule - The molecule that is searched for the closest atom
Returns:
The atom that is closest to the given coordinates

getMinMax

public static double[] getMinMax(RenderingAtoms container)
Returns the minimum and maximum X and Y coordinates of the atoms in the AtomContainer. The output is returned as: 
   minmax[0] = minX;
   minmax[1] = minY;
   minmax[2] = maxX;
   minmax[3] = maxY;

Returns:
An four int array as defined above.

getNormalizationFactor

public static double getNormalizationFactor(RenderingAtoms container)
Calculates the normalization factor in order to get an average bond length of 1.5. It takes only into account Bond's with two atoms.

getScaleFactor

public static double getScaleFactor(RenderingAtoms ac,
                                    double bondLength)
Determines the scale factor for displaying a structure loaded from disk in a frame. An average of all bond length values is produced and the structure is scaled such that the resulting bond length divided by the character size equals the current Chemistry Development Kit (CKD)Models bondlengthToCharactersizeRatio setting.

Parameters:
ac - The AtomContainer for which the ScaleFactor is to be calculated
Returns:
The ScaleFactor with which the AtomContainer must be scaled

has2DCoordinates

public static boolean has2DCoordinates(RenderingAtoms m)
Determines if this AtomContainer contains 2D coordinates.

Returns:
boolean indication that 2D coordinates are available

has2DCoordinates

public static boolean has2DCoordinates(Atom a)
Determines if this Atom contains 2D coordinates.

Returns:
boolean indication that 2D coordinates are available

Returns:

Rotates a molecule around a given center by a given angle

Parameters:
molecule - The molecule to be rotated

                                 Dimension areaDim,
                                 double fillFactor)
Scales a molecule such that it fills a given percentage of a given dimension

Parameters:
molecule - The molecule to be scaled
dim - The dimension to be filled
percentage - The percentage of the dimension to be filled

translate2D

public static void translate2D(RenderingAtoms atomCon,
                               javax.vecmath.Vector2d vector)
Translates a molecule from the origin to a new point denoted by a vector.

Parameters:
atomCon - molecule to be translated
vector - dimension that represents the translation vector

translate2D

public static void translate2D(RenderingAtoms atomCon,
                               double transX,
                               double transY)
Translates the given molecule by the given Vector.

Parameters:
molecule - The molecule to be translated
transX - translation in x direction
transY - translation in y direction

translate2DCentreOfMassTo

public static void translate2DCentreOfMassTo(RenderingAtoms atomCon,
                                             javax.vecmath.Point2d p)
Translates a molecule from the origin to a new point denoted by a vector.

Parameters:
atomCon - molecule to be translated
vector - dimension that represents the translation vector

translateAllPositive

public static void translateAllPositive(RenderingAtoms atomCon)
Adds an automatically calculated offset to the coordinates of all atoms such that all coordinates are positive and the smallest x or y coordinate is exactly zero.

Parameters:
molecule - for which all the atoms are translated to positive coordinates
